definition: doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
constructivist theory
pinyin: jian4 gou4 zheng4 yi4 li3 lun4

sentences.english: The other idea supporting instructional technology is the theory of progressivism.
sentences.chinese: 支持教育技术的另一个观点是进步主义理论。

sentences.english: Dai Zhen was a unique scholar during the Qian- Jia time, who was expert at textual research and argumentation.
sentences.chinese: 戴震兼擅义理与考据，在乾嘉学术史上独树一帜。

sentences.english: Which should we accept: prioritarianism or utilitarianism?
sentences.chinese: 优先主义理论和功利主义理论，我们应接受哪个？

sentences.english: The principle enlightens us when we observe the operation of Nature.
sentences.chinese: 而这种义理是我们观察自然运行得到的启示。

sentences.english: Second, seen from the method of research, Neo-Confucianism is an " argumentative philosophy".
sentences.chinese: 其次，从研究方法看，道学是义理之学。

definition: study of the Confucian classics
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
Confucianism
profound theory/philosophical theory of Wei and Jin 玄學|玄学 sect
Confucian
poetry and prose/rhetoric
doctrine (religion)

Six Classics, namely: Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], Book of History 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], Book of Rites 儀禮|仪礼[Yi2 li3], the lost Book of Music 樂經|乐经[Yue4 jing1], Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1]
subtle words with profound meaning (idiom)
principle/logic
Confucian study of ethics/study of Daoism/school for Daoism in Tang and Song times/Daoist magic/another name for 理學|理学, rational learning of Song dynasty neo-Confucianism
religious text
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
to study the underlying principle to acquire knowledge (idiom); pursuing knowledge to the end
